title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1 ยง 200.8 - Decision of the commissioner
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1 ยง 200.8 - Decision of the commissioner

State Regulations

Every marketing order shall be accompanied by a written
decision of the commissioner, and such decision shall recite the referendum
vote for and against the order and shall contain a certification that the
percentage of producers required to approve the order, as provided in section
294, subdivision
2
of
the Agriculture and Markets Law, has been met. If a marketing order is not
approved, a written decision shall be rendered by the commissioner stating the
number of votes against and for approval, and certifying that the percentage of
producers required to approve the order, as provided by the aforesaid
subdivision of the law, has not been met. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1
ยง
200.8

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
